alert.note: Alert for Le Flore; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 7:47AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Crawford, Sebastian, eastern Sequoyah and northeastern Le Flore Counties through 830 AM CDT... At 746 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles west of Short to 3 miles north of Bonanza to 5 miles west of Hartford. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Cedarville... Greenwood... Alma... Barling... Pocola... Roland... Lavaca... Arkoma... Mansfield... Dyer... Hackett... Hartford... Huntington... Bonanza... Midland... Moffett... Rudy... Excelsior... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 17. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 322 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
